eW19VnHS_YMVqPTsMXygIQ.text: I had really good vegetarian food.  Loved the gorgonzola cheese on a stick with honey. Really fun place, but dress up because everyone is.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. The decor at Sexy fish
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. The amazing Decor at Sexy Fish
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. The Mermaids by Damien Hirst and ceiling by Frank Gehry at Sexy Fish

jF3SshhoNZ32ayzisV81aQ.text: I don't know where to start, service, food, atmosphere, all top notch. A great experience, leaving me relaxed, well fed, and feeling like i had experienced something special :)

eAX1f05PEN5QDrn7lsR0Bg.text: The Scallops and Seabass really stood out, along with Damien Hirst's mermaid statues.

bZ1FuQAV9bMg-6aHrbE8Qw.text: I always wish there was a way to give zero stars.  Was told the wait was an hour and then jerked around by the staff as other parties were seated.  Love British service.  Hard to tell about the food as I never had any.

XNpmcRmYPaXAcaMf0qDP2Q.text: Absolutely beautiful restaurant, however the food and service was a complete let down considering the expense. Ordered a starter of steak, and the meat was so chewy I couldn't even eat it. The worst part was when we had to move tables because of a creepy gentleman taking pictures. Told the staff he was blatantly taking pictures of us, and instead of confronting the man they moved our table. Really disappointed because the restaurant itself has so much potential.

cCBL_QoXLSjeZKYDKymFSQ.text: Went on a busy Friday night with no reservation and was able to snag one of the tables next the the bat which was perfect. Ordered a few of the champagne cocktails while I waited for my table.  They were pretty good but I especially liked the glassware.  More the most part everything I ordered was quite bland. The apps were unmemorable. I had the tempura crab and some sushi roll.. The main (seabass) was ok..very well cooked but... to sweet for my taste. The best part of the meal was actually the olives they serve at the bar! Haha I couldn't stop eating them. Also the cheesecake dessert was amazing and quite large.  Definitely shareable. The service was great from the time we entered until the time we left.  We didn't have a reservation and the could have been rude but they worked us in. And our waitress, Canadian girl was lovely. Would definitely return for the ambience. Definitely a sexy place!

3GW0tR9sV2WoqUWk6LqPyg.text: Should be renamed sh*tty fish- be warned, no matter how much you order, you will unapologetically be asked to vacate your seat after 2 hours. Not worth the money, they should pay you to suffer their service.

V-fiqddTTSyqMS3xfZgHfQ.text: It's reputation doesn't precede it. Very subpar. Not very nice ambience, music too loud you can't even hear yourself talk and the food was very mediocre - and for such a high price. The manager made a great effort but not worth it at alllllll

OeG76byAp4zOH3S7q3LbZQ.text: Ordered the sushi (tempura, California and tuna)Not the best The spicy noodles ,had an overwhelming ginger flavour Beer root salad was okaish The sweet potato was edible

DBFSZyjzYYnH3qtrBqEUbA.text: Exquisitely and eclectically decorated hot spot offering dishes designed for sharing to maximise your culinary experience.  Seafood is celebrated through plates with global influences from Japan to Italy to America and beyond -- unique flavours meant to tantalise your plate; wonderful experience! Dungarvan Oysters were delicious and salty; very sexy start to the meal!!!Seared Yellowfin Tuna was not so sexy ... the dish wasn't very flavourful and I was looking for something more. Duck salad made up of carefully chosen pieces of crispy roasted duck with a hoisin-style dressing & creamy avocado-herbaceous green sauce #sexyduck The Tuna tartare with truffle oil and truffles was out of this world!!  I would go back and have this every single time. Wow!!The Mizo Glazed Chilean Sea Bass comes in at a close second to the tuna ... Really fantastic. The service was wonderful -- very attentive and "customer is always right" suave attitude ... let us linger over each course as long as we wanted.  Will be back once my bank account recovers and I can get another ressie!

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Miso Chilean Sea Bass
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Single oyster
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Duck salad

w_GGkW881Vc6-Kvgp8hQLg.text: Wife saw Sexy Fish as we were walking about Mayfair and was lucky enough to get a table Immediately by the bar. The food and service were excellent and impressed. We had several small platters as much of the menu is tapas style and everything was great. The oysters were extremely fresh and the sashimi was outstanding. We also saw Alexis Sanchez, the star player for Arsenal Football Club. I highly recommend getting reservations ahead of time but this is a must restaurant in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Amazing bar at Sexy Fish
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Champagne at Sexy Fish

aL_GSMqitefO-YaNQCAttg.text: The food and ambience here is worth 5 stars - hands down delicious, and some of the best Japanese I have ever tasted. We had beef tataki, langoustines tempura, prawn gyoza, duck, tenderloin (divine) and grilled avocado and tofu (so good we had to have 2!). The wine was excellent. On a bill of over £500 I would not expect to be told - with food still on the table, and wine yet to be poured - we have people waiting for our table and asked to finish. Great food, matched by great arrogance. After some heated discussion a 'lucky' table was found at the bar with desserts complementary, but the damage was done.

L3xw_uPTmn-hq330aMD9OA.text: Came here on a recommendation from a local colleague. We were a bit early for the lunch crowd when we came at noon (silly Americans) but the place filled up quickly and was quite buzzing around 1:30 when we wrapped up. The decor is beautiful. I would love to hear the background on how their Damien Hirst came to be. I'd recommend the duck salad which was cooked perfectly and had a great balance between the richness of the duck and the lightness of the other components which kept it from being too heavy.

xV2lE9xjggzIXeDYKi-COw.text: Sexy fish First impressions I wasn't impressed.When you first get there, there is not 1 but 2 door men opening the heavy doors, 3 people at the reception desk and another one asking to take your coat, we didn't have a reservation so I guess it was our lucky day, before being escorted to our table we were told we had 2 hours..this kind of restaurants are a bit cheeky you might ended up expending £200-300 and they want you to eat in a hurry agh :/Firstly I must say great job sexy fish on the marketing and the decor, oh dear trust me when you get there its not such a big deal' they might need to concentrate on the food now' With nobu and novikov around the corner they better step their game upFood is ok nothing out of this worldDon't expect great flavours haunting you for days thinking how did they do it because it's not gonna happen, food is good, fresh and tasty, some of the dishes at least .I think when you know how sublime tastes like you can tell the difference, food is far from the flavours you might get at zuma or nobu which is the best I've had in London. I can't recommend anything as to me it was just food nothing special (Probably the sexy fish version of porn star martini was the best thing ha please keep them coming I shouted ;P )Dishes rank from £10 to £30 each unless you have, wagyu beef £100 per 150gr or caviar I think it was £100 per 100grDecor. Sexy fish belong to Caprice Holdings, owned by restaurateur Richard Caring,  he also has the Ivy, J. Sheekey, Le Caprice, and Scott's, so no surprises they have expend £20 millions in decor' with great names as Martin Brudnizki Design StudioFrank GehryDamien Hirst Michael RobertsArt is the main thing in this place, marble walls, pink leather sits..Tbh there's toooooo much going on, and the colours don't blend together, that's my humble opinion. A giant black crocodile hanging in one of the walls, a mermaid and a shark on another wall and the ceiling it's just too much..They also have an open kitchen. However my fav was the bar with water cascades windows, the mermaids at the end of the bar and the shimmering fishes hanging on top.Apart from the main dinning room They also have a private room in the lower ground floor, called The Coral Reef Room, with the largest live coral reef tank in the world (apparently)Atmosphere, wealthy people you can smell the money Service was ExcellentAlthough I must say when we first arrived, sexy fishes Pet was awaiting for us' a no so sexy baby fly was going around the tables, certainly not impressed, at first we laugh but by the end of the starters I've had enough and I told the waiter I even showed it to him, he didn't know what to say, after a while I remember ordering our main and wondering where's our waiter, he and the pet went MIA, as a guy with a bright blue jacket was serving us, whatever they did it worked ha I didn't really talk about the food cos I don't have anything good to say, I definitely will give it another go, maybe another day and probably lunch, right now I think it's ok' Maybe overrated but hey right now it's the hottest place in London'

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Open kitchen@sexy fish
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Ceiling@sexy fish
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Soft sell crab roll@sexy fish

jurPcrahJvVvoTkAIPM3nA.text: Don't bother booking here. They don't honor reservations. Had an 11pm reservation, arrived at 10:40pm. Sent to bar. By 11:45 after being told a few times our table would be ready soon, we left.

5aIRucUgvopLUCm_T-PB2Q.text: We had heard a lot about sexy fish- and read a few reviews upon open that seemed to be a bit mixed, but we went excited with an open mind. We thought to give it a try and see what the hype was about. On the exterior the restaurant looks fun, inside a pretty open space. We were greeted nicely. So here is the interesting part- we are pretty big foodies so we're excited to see what they had to bring to the table. We order a few items- wing skewers, octopus, duck salad, sea bass, Madagascan prawn and a few more items. Although the restaurant and service presented itself like a well designed place, the food was surprisingly underwhelming. Duck salad was nice, dressing was well done, but we weren't wowed. Skewers were fine. The sea bass we were surprised was over cooked but the dish itself wasn't amazing like when you go to other restaurants with a miso cod or bass. We were a bit disappointed. The Madagascan prawn was under seasoned and not much to write about. A few of the dishes seemed to be a bit on the heavy side (bass and veg seemed to have a layer of butter or oil)I can say the rice crispy green tea ice cream was very nice.Wine is punchy as well as a glass is the price of a bottle bought anywhere elseHope this helps those of you foodies debating to dine here.

_jBUFxbXX0oz6tDwqtUPTw.text: They are a racist restaurant.  I just walked out of the restaurant spending US1,000 on dinner and when I wanted to go back inside because my husband was waiting for his jacket, they stopped me telling me I couldn't go in.  They let the westerners in but not the Asians.  How can they do that when this is a Japanese restaurant!!!  Also the hostess was insisting that we sit down for dinner when we were at the bar for a drink and our reservation was still 30 mins later.  I would say that this restaurant sucks and the service is horrible and people are rude.  It is overpriced given the service.  I will never go there again!!

rsbDJ-K3FWznGtkZDhfoLQ.text: Amazing! Great Japanese food with a western and modern twist! Don't be fooled by the name- it's not only seafood which is good, everything is great! Sexy Fish roll would make a good start to the meal, order anything in between, and end with yuzu marshmallow dessert (words won't be able to describe the experience!)We didn't have a booking and got the counter seats which we were very happy with. Great service and wonderful attention to details! If you want to be guaranteed to get in book months in advance!Enjoy!

0QBXxn5z8qswkX11_vlbjw.text: The wine selection is limited..but the food was pretty good. The grilled octopus skewers with the potatoes was amazing . The yellowtail sashimi appetizer was just ok. Probably should have stuck to simple sashimi- it's my favorite!. It was already busy at 6pm...though in London everyone goes out straight from the office!  Worth a try if you're in the area, or hosting a group.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom

9Q_QlrEr5r9PbzGQ7TWgnw.text: I was taken here for my birthday on Saturday and had a great time! The decor of the venue is stunning, including the running water feature on the windows and the fish sculptures above the bar. The atmosphere was relaxed but sophisticated and the service was top notch. The wait staff were there when you needed them and really attentive without being pushy. The food was also stunning - the yellowtail sashimi and soft shell crab maki were both stunning! The Chilean seabass was also very tasty, similar to the black cod you would get at places like Nobu. The fashion inspired cocktails were also so fun- my drink had its own catwalk! Would absolutely recommend and return.

Xg-f4Htd-SyBp9tz8lx2Og.text: Ahhhh...when something is this good it's hard to want to share it but seeing as I'm a wonderful human being I shall in this case  As a lover of seafood I knew I would love this place! The menu is just as beautiful as the venue..did the little mermaid live in such surroundings under the sea? If so I have no idea why she wanted out! Anyhow back on topic....I don't want to make this review too long and that's exactly what will happen if I go into the details of what we ate so take it from me it's a great spot!! From sushi to oysters to scallops...everything .... They've got it all and it's all delicious and beautifully presented. Love you sexy fish! You truly were sexy

PVe__TEPUJi9pCArSfftAw.text: Visiting London and this was a last minute recommendation as a great place and managed to get an early reservation, which was apparently quite lucky. Our local guide has once again not steered us wrong as Sexy Fish was excellent.  Service is amazing.  Our waiter was attentive with good humour and random servers were often dropping by to make quick, and unobtrusive, work of dish cleanup or glass refills.The spicy tuna maki we started with were good but unremarkable, that was really the only slight setback of the night.Beef skewers were delicious and deeply marinaded.  The creamy wasabi dip was a prefect compliment.  The prawn gyoza were delicious and we fought briefly over the fifth gyoza.The lamb cutlets were very good, the cucumber side dish with the slight mint flavour worked very well as a complement. The Mizo Glazed Chilean Sea Bass was the highlight for me and was a surprisingly large serving for a London restaurant.  We almost skipped desert but decided to indulge in the vanilla rice pudding that was truly worth every calorie.  The pudding itself was creamy and cooked to perfection.  The whole dish was served hot and quickly, the vanilla ice cream added as a topping was still perfectly chilled upon arrival.  Speaking of the ice cream, it was sweet, rich and full of vanilla;  it bodes well for anybody ordering an ice cream or gelato as a desert.

sDf-i954e9ocK7_UTM9Lqw.text: Underwhelming to say the least. I have been to plenty of nice restaurants in NYC and this falls short in almost all categories.  The food is okay. It is simple and unimaginative. The service is slow and the waiters do not explain the dishes well. It is also incredibly hard to get a cab when leaving. We waiting 30 minutes and eventually used uber. Maybe its a london thing, but they do not call cabs here. Doormen were useless. Expectation of a restaurant like this should be for them to run down to a busier corner to hail cabs.  Again, its lack of service.Also watch out for the 4 pound cover charge. This is different then the service charge. It is just a random 4 pound charge to scam you essentially. If you ask them to remove it, they will but obnoxious they put it on in first place and most people either don't realize its there or just accept it and do not ask.I will say it did have a good ombionce. A very trendy feel. Surprisingly I was seated right when I got to the restaurant instead of being shown the bar which is always a plus.At end of the day, there are clearly better restaurants than this in London especially for the price.  It is new and hip but thats about all.

sfIr8eCy3mblHOxFLMKZ9Q.text: Sexy Fish is a new trendy restaurant in Mayfair.  It's hard to get a booking, but if you can get one, you're in for a treat.  I have zero complaints about the food and decor.  The place is STUNNING.  Seriously jaw-droppingly beautiful.  The food was so fresh and flavourful.  Presentation was also great.  My only knock down from 5 stars was the service.  I was with a group of 5 girls, and because we weren't rich, well-to-do celebrities or socialites, we felt we didn't get the same level of service that the people around us got.  All the tables around us had £500 bottles of wine and champagne flowing, and I think that is why we didn't get the same service.  The hostess was kind of rude as well.  For the price, I'm not sure I'd go back...it's definately worth going to once just to see the spectacle of it all.

jcE3bP1ZgJAmqrYOqRNa1w.text: I don't know what a big fuss is about this place ! The restaurant itself is super , toilet , staff...but the food is not all that , maybe I didn't know what to order but 8 dishes and 2 desserts...none of them was nice (I don't think I'm a fussy eater). All and all I would say I wouldn't be back anytime soon. Therefore I can only give 3stars for the actual place and design , 1star for the food !

uMk44Czo-TFmUHXFyjOC-A.text: I'm told it's THE place to be right now. And when you walk in it is indeed extremely seductive. Water cascades down the walls, and it's not cos they've got a pipes problem upstairs. Even the ceiling has its own wallpaper. It's loud and big and extremely buzzy.  Large works of art by renowned artists. They've gone to town here. Berkeley Sq pizazz. Hoards of people quaff champagne at the bar and there are a smattering of well known types.To the left of me Judge Rinder. Wide berth. To the right, James De Gale. Deffo worth a handshake when you're drunk and happy. I slide over and take my tablecloth with me. Mayhem. Crash bang wallop. Glass everywhere. He took it well, and the staff were there to clean up with military precision. Slick operation. But part of why you go to a restaurant has to be the food, and this is something of a let down.It's not often you go to a nice restaurant and have a dish you positively don't like. My potato and octopus skewer was horrible. Covered in some acrid nastiness which totally obliterated the poor cephalopod. I don't know what the potato was doing on the skewer but it didn't stand a chance either.Oysters were fresh and lovely and so they should be at that price. Mixed veg tempura came with a nice crisp batter as you'd expect.Madagascan prawn was delicate and tasty. But the noodles we ordered to go with it came long after we had finished the prawn dish. We quibbled. Apparently the food just comes as it's ready. So we enjoyed our bowl of noodles on their own at the end of the meal. If that's the way it really is supposed to work, it doesn't!I found the menu a little difficult to get my head round, split as it was into 'hot dishes', 'cold dishes', 'Robata' (grill I think), and 'raw dishes'. We aimlessly meandered around the menu picking bits and bobs and the end result was a rather unmemorable, bitty collection of dishes.For the black ops style sweeping up of the carnage, the visual mayhem of the place and the general pandemonium inside I give five stars. You certainly know you've been on a night out and it's a lot of fun. But I wrestle two stars back for a lacklustre meal that lacked cohesion, which peaked at nice but bottomed out at yukky.

7bDn5qdKUurtR6jiUHRwEA.text: Best salmon I've ever had. Even better than the fish at Le Bernardin in NYC. Scallops presentation was gorgeous. Get the chef's table in the back. Excellent service and the chefs are very approachable. Espresso martini was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom

4mwmNzC3rDFGDpIgEXCL_A.text: This was one of the best restaurants in london.The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great can't ask for more. If you go there don't miss there special cheese cake dessert it's definitely the best cheese cake I have ever tried I would fly to london for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom

1LFLjGKaOrqDuD36qGAbHQ.text: I loved the fried rice I got here. My boyfriend really enjoyed the sushi. Great ambiance and very friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom

8_so2_GOIv9b8HY5T3S-jQ.text: From the cocktails to the sushi, everything we had was pretty impressive. Loved the wings and ribs you have to try them. Treat yourself to the Chilean sea bass. You won't be disappointed. The service was pretty great too. End your meal with the cheesecake,  it was delightful!!!  Overall, it was the best meal we had in London. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom

qrKnLFcBOto8JEkCqyb3Ag.text: I am extremely disappointed with this restaurant. We checked the dress code and we dressed smart causal. If you are going to have a check list of some sort, post it. We weren't allowed in, even with our reservation, because one of us wore tennis shoes, other people behind us had tennis shoes and where allowed in. I won't suggest coming here, there is obviously some sort of secret dress code that allows some people who "break" the code in and keeps others out.

ViopBuhD4fYUqdqWSB42bw.text: Oh Sexy fish is oh so sexy! If looking for the "It" place that is stunning, with sexy people, decor, and food this is your one stop shop! Of course dress smart, look fabulous, and you will quickly make friends while dining on divine sushi and taste cocktails! One of our favorite restaurants in Europe hands down!

yYAtgYj8ZvB_mSYv0FQ9bg.text: Kinda overrated. The food was great nonetheless but I wasn't wowed. Still would go back

BBYs3nU9Ai-IedwBzbPe5w.text: Great name - I really wanted to like this place. But it was not meant to be.Nice atmosphere. I could spend an hour or two there with a nice bottle of wine!The staff were great. Ultimately the let down was the food. It tried its best but fundamentally it was uninteresting  and two of my party were a little unhappy stomach wise at the end.Cost wise - not worth it. The combination of the food and the costs merited the 2 stars. Again this is regrettable- I really wanted to like it.

aein6d3xWPOKL8BCyhYCpg.text: Chef Bjoern is a genius in the kitchen! This restaurant deserves a Michelin star. He combines flavors that work well without overpowering the dish (example: yellowtail with smoked tofu and caviar!), miso Chilean sea bass with 3 way cauliflower was great. Highlight was mushroom tempura with truffle sauce- devoured this plate. Dessert can't be missed- warm out of oven cinnamon donuts as well as iced peanut butter were amazingly delicious dishes! We sat at chef's table which was a real treat as the chef engaged with us trough the meal. This is a must when in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Yellowtail tartar with smoked tofu!
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. iced Peanut butter dessert

Bq8xwUuqivjThvNuPZub7w.text: Amazing place for a very special event The atmosphere is buzzing even on a Monday night.Its Mayfair so prepare to splash some big MO! I tried the "It wasabi time" cocktail while waiting for my friends and its like a sushi in a glass. I know it doesnt sound appealing but it is delicious.There are only 2 wines under 40£ so choose wisely . We had a bottle of Torrontes white which was perfect for the warm weather we had and "only" 36£ Food wise we shared the tartare of beef (one my fav), Octopus carpaccio (really well balanced but slightly too thin), Wagyu beef gunkan (a let down you it could have been any beef, the Wagyu wasnt well represented in the dish), grilled avocado and fried the tofu (just ok), prawn gyoza (good), crispy soft shell crab (good but Ive had better), grilled octopus and potatoes skewers and pork belly skewers (good but Ive had better) Miso glazed chilean sea bass (a bit dry but tasty overall) and The whole lobster (Lobster was delish especially the bbq oil sauce it really enhanced it).But the highlight for me was the desserts. They have an interesting assortments of sorbet and ice cream and I had hands down the best pineapple cake in my entire life (so far )Overall this is great place for a birthday, big business deal etc but it wont become my go to place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Miso glazed Chilean Seabass
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Skewers: potatoes and grilled octopus - pork belly
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Prawn gyoza

O46IaNA355QSRjPtBOmYpQ.text: We had dinner at sexy fish and it was hands down one of our best dining experiences. The service was outstanding. Our waitress, as well as all the staff, were extremely attentive. The food could not have been better. The yellow tail sashimi, tuna tar tar and sea bass were three of the best fish dishes we've ever had. These dishes came recommended by an employee of the restaurant who came over and helped with our order, and he was not only friendly, all his recommendations were amazing! The restaurant was pricey but well worth it in our opinion.

NIxtNoE-1nK6si2JueQC2Q.text: This place was so cool..I went to Sexy Fish for my birthday dinner with my family and I had their F'row (Front Row..in case anyone was wondering!!) which was so good and it came out on a little catwalk (hence the name).  The food was really good and the service was very good as well.  The ambiance was very trendy, fashionista, and posh.  I probably won't go back to Sexy Fish again to celebrate my birthday, but I will always have this past birthday celebration in my mind.

ZMeBiW0EcVhsjIzeJrdYOg.text: The atmosphere at this restaurant is great.  It is full of energy and has the feel of a nightclub, while serving excellent food.  The sushi rolls were delicious and unique. I loved the combinations they put together.  We will definitely return on my next trip to London.

Pg8wycNGDxOetOKISSclEQ.text: First of all; I liked how nice they were in spite of me being 20 minutes late to my reservation. We were seated right away and our waitress, a really nice girl from Brazil, recommended a few things from the menu which were all great. The Sexy Fish roll was amazing, probably the freshest sushi I've ever tasted...although I think fish has to be frozen at least 24 hours before being sold in Europe, but I couldn't tell hahaThe crispy duck salad was good but I didn't like the pieces of watermelon thrown in there, so I avoided those and let my friend eat them which he appreciated. They should call it Sexy Duck salad, though. Then we had the foie gras gyoza which was my favourite, I loved the sauce they were in. For pudding we had the coconut and pineapple cake which was good but not as good as I had imagined, just average. All in all, it was a great experience. I especially loved the lady sitting across from my table with massive lip injections and super bleached hair. An iconic and timeless beauty.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom

oSe2jMEzX_T6yBzhmrspuA.text: Nice place we ordered couple rolls I liked. I wasn't impressed by the food nor the service. It took us a long time to get our order and our waitress was actually rude. My girlfriend was offended . I mean if you don't like dealing with people just don't work darling ... the black code wasn't the best I had tried. I think this shouldn't be considered a must try sushi in London like nooooo rocka zuma Nobu serve way better food.

il9Jk0Tuant_y7ePdb79wA.text: As it is called,it has lots and lots of sexy fish. The decore & embrace are upscale and the food is above average.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Fried soft shell crap.
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Fried soft shell crap.

ZztTl9LHWt1wknzgZ7m5ig.text: This restaurant is for those who want to be seen rather than eat good food. Love the booking tactic of we only have early or super late bookings because they have to let everyone think the restaurant is packed, it isn't the case.No dish was even close to Nobu, let alone Zuma. So on the bill a cover charge, not sure what for but ok.There were only two warm sake choices, we started with one however it tasted rather watered down, we ordered a second of the same, hoping that it was a one off error, it wasn't. Ordered the other sake, same watered down taste.Every item we had, if there was no sauce, the tastes were bland and unseasoned, if there was a sauce, the taste was so overpowering that, you only tasted the sauce.Started with kingfish sashimi, sauce on it, couldn't taste the fish, poor.Seared tuna, fine but sauce again, no other taste.Beef and foie gras gyoza, wow this was bad, what foie gras, all you tasted was the excessive amount of liquid sauce they sat in with a little bit of dough. TerriblePrawn tempura, average, same quality of itsu. Has the chef ever had the tempura at zuma, i doubt it.Salt and pepper squid, no salt, no pepper, just fried chewy calamari in a basic batter, itsu is better, so is hakkasan.Chicken wings on skewer, fine if you added plenty of salt and lime, that said in comparison to Zuma, not even close. Zuma serves small, much more delicate wings which are very tasty, these were huge wings, perhaps you'd find them at a fried chicken shop.Two of the worst dishes that we didnt even eat, they ultimately took them off the bill. Pork skewers, huge chunks of dry disgusting pork with no taste. Duck salad, was a disgrace, note for the chef, try it at Hakkasan or Yautcha, you have something to learn. The duck was so dry and chewy. Inedible.Chilean sea bass was good. NY Strip steak, asked for medium rare, was tasty but overcooked, needed seasoning. Overpowering taste of charcoal.So all in all a terrible restaurant, especially compared to others. Sell some artwork, and hire a proper chef! I guess as long as the restaurant remains the place to be, people will go but will ever be on par with the quality and tastes of Zuma, i doubt it.

rGVsjCuF-hCvs_yh0DvpNA.text: I liked the atmosphere, which is classy, trendy, and modern with music that is not too loud. We were seated on time for our reservation. However, for the price, I have experienced better. The service was alright, our main server only took our order once then disappeared for the night. He had assistants just serve us and no one came to check up on our table. The food was mediocre, definitely not worth the price I was paying for. However, the Baked King Crab leg was the best dish out of the ones I ordered at Sexy Fish and would order again if I were to revisit.However, I will not be visiting Sexy Fish again, not because the food was bad, but because the service was not up to par. The main server never informed us about last call. When we attempted to order more food he gave us a rude look and attitude despite of his mistake. Though management removed some dishes from our bill, I still will not be visiting again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Baked Alaskan Crab
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Beef & Foie Gras Gyoza
Photo of Sexy Fish - London, United Kingdom. Salmon Carpaccio

5fmdYGGfoM8QofkeLpAGZg.text: We came early for our reservation and waited 2 hours for our table.  After awhile we realized they were seating based not on reservation times but on prepayments and /or name recognition.   We ultimately asked one of the many Russian ladies at the bar to help get a seat, who were very friendly.The food was weak, sushi was not fresh and everything was covered in too many sauces.   The bill includes a cover charge which is something I never see at a restaurant, only bars.  Maybe this is really a bar that serves food, and not a restaurant that serves drinks.  Given the many great restaurants in London, I would not recommend going to salty fish if you are looking for a fine meal, especially given the very high price point.

ii9KdIBmklS2XT7CwYpUTQ.text: We were recommended to Sexy Fish by a friend who is impressed with big spaces and loud music so should have known better. Food is average but the service is way below average. If this place was in NYC it would be out of business within a year. Don't waste your money or time. Go somewhere else.
